text.__SUMMARY__: Leccinum boreale is a species of bolete fungus in the family Boletaceae. The bolete was described as new to science in 1966 by mycologists Alexander H. Smith, Harry Delbert Thiers, and Roy Watling.A motion in legislature proposed to make this the official fungus of Alberta in 2009.
